body:
Since we have bumped etcd version to 2.2.1, there exists a problem with etcd when deploying the cluster [ubuntu]. 
I'm not positive whether it's fatal or not, and file this issue in case some one would love to pick it up. Or i'll follow this thread early next week. 
- Case 1

```
etcd start/running, process 336
Error:  client: etcd cluster is unavailable or misconfigured
error #0: dial tcp 127.0.0.1:2379: getsockopt: connection refused
error #1: dial tcp 127.0.0.1:4001: getsockopt: connection refused

Error:  client: etcd cluster is unavailable or misconfigured
error #0: dial tcp 127.0.0.1:4001: getsockopt: connection refused
error #1: dial tcp 127.0.0.1:2379: getsockopt: connection refused

Error:  100: Key not found (/coreos.com) [10]
{"Network":"172.19.0.0/16"}
{"Network":"172.19.0.0/16"}
```
- Case 2

```
etcd start/running, process 425
etcd cluster has no published client endpoints.
Try '--no-sync' if you want to access non-published client endpoints(http://127.0.0.1:4001,http://127.0.0.1:2379).
Error:  client: no endpoints available
etcd cluster has no published client endpoints.
Try '--no-sync' if you want to access non-published client endpoints(http://127.0.0.1:4001,http://127.0.0.1:2379).
Error:  client: no endpoints available
Error:  100: Key not found (/coreos.com) [10]
{"Network":"172.16.0.0/16"}

```

For case 2, adding param `--no-sync` for `etcdctl` would fix this.

This may apply to all other platforms.

/cc @resouer  @WIZARD-CXY

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

title: [ubuntu] etcd error during upstart process
